subject: Sleep
title: Stage N2 True Sleep Begins
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Stage N2 True Sleep Begins.

hook.text: You spend about half your total sleep time in one stage. Not deep sleep. Not REM. Stage N2.

buildup.text: N2 is the workhorse of sleep. It makes up 45 to 55 percent of a normal night's rest.

discovery.text: During N2, the brain produces sleep spindles, rapid bursts of activity that lock the door to wakefulness.

twist.text: These spindles are not random noise. They actively block external sounds from reaching consciousness.

climax.text: People with more sleep spindles are heavier sleepers. Spindle density is partly genetic.

punchline.text: N2 is the stage you spend the most time in.

quiz.question: What percentage of sleep is typically spent in N2?
